intro: Tachiadenus platypterus subsp. platypterus, commonly known as the flat-leaf tachiadenus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features narrow, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the cooler months. It is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
